Uses sonar screens to track Dick's fall and times another Batarang throw to catch him just above the rocks, then uses the bat-winch to pull them back up.
Attempts to outsmart Two-Face by reaching for his Utility Belt as Two-Face flips his coin, showing quick thinking under pressure.
Fails to secure the coin flip, allowing Two-Face to lose balance and fall, which indirectly resolves the threat but also shows a slight miscalculation in reach.
Looks down at Edward with sad, compassionate eyes and speaks gently, expressing choice and care.
Reaches out to Edward to offer comfort, though Edward reacts with fear.
Slams the power switch to cut off the Riddler's neural energy supply, effectively stopping him.
Shows compassion and understanding toward Edward Nygma despite his madness.
Reaches out to Edward to help him, but Edward reacts with fear.
Sends Alfred to personally thank Dr. Meridian and convey apologies, along with a symbolic gift (the dream doll), showing consideration and gratitude.
Remains absent during a tense moment at Arkham Asylum, delegating interaction to Alfred rather than engaging directly.
Sends Alfred to pick up Dr. Meridian and deliver a message and a symbolic gift, showing thoughtful delegation and emotional intelligence.
Remains absent during a critical moment at Arkham Asylum, potentially missing direct engagement.
Stands vigilantly on top of a skyscraper at night, demonstrating watchfulness and commitment to protecting the city.
Joins forces with Robin, indicating strategic partnership and teamwork.
